alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 09 at 6:20PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A tropical circulation is expected to develop near the CNMI for the middle to end of next week. Almost all of the numerical models indicate this potential, but differ on timing, strength, and location of the developing system. This increases uncertainty as to where and when the heaviest rainfall will occur. At this time, Tinian and Saipan look to have the highest potential, where rainfall totals of 3 to 6 inches may develop, with locally higher amounts possible. Farther south for Rota and Guam, rainfall totals look to be in the 2 to 4 inch range, with locally higher amounts possible. Gusty winds will also be probable with any heavier shower or thunderstorm that develops. Should this occur as forecast, urban and small stream flooding would be a distinct possibility. Closely monitor this developing situation in the event watches, advisories, or warnings are needed. Make sure nearby storm drains are not clogged, especially for low-lying or flood-prone areas.
